title: Portfolio Setup Instructions
text:
Welcome to MUSA 5080! This guide will help you set up your personal portfolio repository for the semester.


By the end of this setup, you’ll have: - Your own portfolio repository on GitHub - live website showcasing your work - A place to document your learning journey




This is what you are building: Dr. Delmelle’s sample portfolio




Before starting, make sure you have: - [ ] A GitHub account (create one here if needed) - [ ] Quarto installed on your computer (download here) - [ ] R and RStudio installed





You should already be in your personal repository (created when you accepted the GitHub Classroom assignment). Now let’s personalize it!



Click on the _quarto.yml file
Click the pencil icon (✏️) to edit
Change "Your Name - MUSA 5080 Portfolio" to include your actual name
Example: "Jane Smith - MUSA 5080 Portfolio"
Click “Commit changes” at the bottom





Click on the index.qmd file
Click the pencil icon (✏️) to edit
Update the “About Me” section with your information:

Your name and background
Your email address
Your GitHub username
Why you’re taking this course

Click “Commit changes”





Navigate to the weekly-notes folder
Click on week-01-notes.qmd
Click the pencil icon (✏️) to edit
Fill in your notes from the first class
Click “Commit changes”





This step makes your portfolio visible as a live website!

Go to Settings: Click the “Settings” tab at the top of your repository
Find Pages: Scroll down and click “Pages” in the left sidebar
Configure Source:

Source: Select “Deploy from a branch”
Branch: Select “main”
Folder: Select “/ (root)”

Save: Click “Save”
Wait: GitHub will show a message that your site is being built (this takes 1-5 minutes)





Find Your URL: After a few minutes, GitHub will show your website URL at the top of the Pages settings

It will look like: https://yourusername.github.io/repository-name

Visit Your Site: Click the link to see your live portfolio!
Bookmark It: Save this URL - you’ll submit it to Canvas





Copy your live website URL
Go to the Canvas assignment
Submit your URL





If you want to work on your computer and see changes before publishing:


# Replace [your-repo-url] with your actual repository URL
git clone [your-repo-url]
cd [your-repository-name]



# Edit your files using RStudio
# Preview your changes:
quarto render
quarto preview

# When ready, save your changes:
git add .
git commit -m "Update portfolio"
git push
Your live website will automatically update when you push changes!




Each week you’ll: 1. Create a new file: weekly-notes/week-XX-notes.qmd 2. Copy the template from week-01-notes.qmd 3. Fill in your reflections and key concepts 4. Commit and push your changes






Wait longer: GitHub Pages can take up to 10 minutes to build
Check Actions tab: Look for any red X marks indicating build failures
Verify Pages settings: Make sure you selected “main” branch and “/ (root)” folder





Check permissions: Make sure you’re in YOUR repository, not the template
Sign in: Ensure you’re signed into GitHub





Check YAML syntax: Make sure your _quarto.yml file has proper formatting
Verify file names: Files should end in .qmd not .md
Look at error messages: The Actions tab will show specific error details





Don’t panic! Every change is tracked in Git
See history: Click the “History” button on any file to see previous versions
Revert changes: You can always go back to a previous version






Commit often: Save your work frequently with descriptive commit messages
Use branches: For major changes, create a new branch and merge when ready
Preview locally: Use quarto preview to see changes before publishing
Keep it professional: This portfolio can be shared with future employers!
Document everything: Good documentation is as important as good analysis





Quarto Documentation
GitHub Docs
Markdown Guide
Git Tutorial




During Class: - Raise your hand for immediate help - Work with classmates - collaboration is encouraged for setup!
Outside Class: - Office Hours: Mondays 1:30-3:00 PM - Email: delmelle@design.upenn.edu - GitHub Issues: Create an issue in your repository for technical problems - Canvas Discussion: Post questions others might have too



Before submitting, make sure you’ve: - [ ] Customized _quarto.yml with your name - [ ] Updated index.qmd with your information - [ ] Completed Week 1 notes - [ ] Enabled GitHub Pages - [ ] Verified your website loads correctly - [ ] Submitted your URL to Canvas

Need help? Don’t struggle alone - reach out during office hours (mine + TAs) or in class!

title: MUSA 5080 Portfolio– Zhanchao Yang (TA)
text:
This portfolio documents my learning journey in Public Policy Analytics (MUSA 5080).


Advanced spatial analysis and data science for urban planning and public policy. I took this course last semester with Dr. Delmelle




Weekly Notes: My learning reflections and key concepts
Labs: Completed assignments and analyses
Final Project: Capstone modeling challenge




I am a second-year dual-degree student in City Planning (Transportation) and the Urban Spatial Analytics program. I am your TA for MUSA 5080: Public Policy Analytics. I hold a bachelor degree in geography from Binghamton University (SUNY). My personal interests include having a cup of coffee and enjoying a coding night. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.




Email: [zhanchao@upenn.edu]
GitHub: [@zyang91]
